parameters.name: DateOfConfiguration
parameters.label: Collection time
parameters.query:
let _configurationEnv = split(iff(isnull({EnvironmentList}) or isempty({EnvironmentList}) or tolower({EnvironmentList}) == "all","All",tostring({EnvironmentList})),',');
ESIExchangeOnlineConfig_CL
| extend ScopedEnvironment = iff(_configurationEnv contains "All", "All",ESIEnvironment_s) 
| where ScopedEnvironment in (_configurationEnv)
| extend Collection = format_datetime(todatetime(EntryDate_s), 'yyyy-MM-dd')
| summarize Collection = max(Collection)
| project Collection = "lastdate", Selected = true
| join kind= fullouter  ( ESIExchangeOnlineConfig_CL | extend ScopedEnvironment = iff(_configurationEnv contains "All", "All",ESIEnvironment_s) 
    | where ScopedEnvironment in (_configurationEnv)
    | where TimeGenerated > ago(90d)
    | extend Collection = format_datetime(todatetime(EntryDate_s), 'yyyy-MM-dd')
    | summarize by Collection 
    | join kind= fullouter ( ESIExchangeOnlineConfig_CL | extend ScopedEnvironment = iff(_configurationEnv contains "All", "All",ESIEnvironment_s) 
        | where ScopedEnvironment in (_configurationEnv)
        | where TimeGenerated > ago(90d)
        | extend Collection = format_datetime(todatetime(EntryDate_s), 'yyyy-MM-dd')
        | extend PreciseCollection = format_datetime(todatetime(EntryDate_s), 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm ')
        | summarize by PreciseCollection, Collection 
        | join kind=leftouter (
            ESIExchangeOnlineConfig_CL | extend ScopedEnvironment = iff(_configurationEnv contains "All", "All",ESIEnvironment_s) 
            | where ScopedEnvironment in (_configurationEnv)
            | where TimeGenerated > ago(90d)
            | extend Collection = format_datetime(todatetime(EntryDate_s), 'yyyy-MM-dd')
            | extend PreciseCollection = format_datetime(todatetime(EntryDate_s), 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm')
            | summarize by PreciseCollection, Collection 
            | summarize count() by Collection
        ) on Collection
    ) on Collection
) on Collection
| project Value = iif(Selected,Collection,iif(count_ > 1,PreciseCollection,Collection1)), Label = iif(Selected,"Last Known date",iif(count_ > 1,PreciseCollection,Collection1)), Selected
| sort by Selected, Value desc

content.json: The current delegation are compared to an export of default delegation available on Exchange Online

parameters.name: RoleAssignee
parameters.query:
let DefMRA = externaldata (Name:string)[h"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nlepagnez/ESI-PublicContent/main/Operations/Watchlists/standardMRAOnline.csv"]with(format="csv",ignoreFirstRecord=true)| summarize make_list(Name);
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="MRA",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "Online")
| where CmdletResultValue.Name !in (DefMRA) and CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeType == "User"
| project CmdletResultValue
| extend RoleAssigneeName = tostring(CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName)
| distinct RoleAssigneeName

content.query:
let DefMRA = externaldata (Name:string)[h"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nlepagnez/ESI-PublicContent/main/Operations/Watchlists/standardMRAOnline.csv"]with(format="csv",ignoreFirstRecord=true)| summarize make_list(Name);
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="MRA",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "Online")
| search "*{RoleAssignee}"
| where CmdletResultValue.Name !in (DefMRA) and CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeType == "User" and CmdletResultValue.Name !contains "Deleg"
| project CmdletResultValue
| extend Name = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Name)
| extend Role = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Role)
| extend RoleAssigneeName = tostring(CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName)
| project Name, Role, RoleAssigneeName
| sort by RoleAssigneeName asc

content.json:
This section displays all the nonstandard delegations done directly to a user account.

Details informations for the user accounts will be displayed.

This status is done by comparing current delegation with the default delegation for Exchange 2019 CU11.

These types of delegations are not available on the Exchange Admin Center.

Usual results :

  - Delegations done directly to service account. Being able to see this delegation will help to sanityze the environment as some delegations may be no more necessary

  - Delegation done by mistake directly to Administrator Accounts

  - Suspicious delegations


Details informations for the user accounts will be displayed in below sections

parameters.name: RoleAssignee
parameters.query:
let DefMRA = externaldata (Name:string)[h"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nlepagnez/ESI-PublicContent/main/Operations/Watchlists/standardMRAOnline.csv"]with(format="csv",ignoreFirstRecord=true)| summarize make_list(Name);
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="MRA",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "Online")
| where CmdletResultValue.Name !in (DefMRA) and CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeType == "RoleGroup"  and CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName !contains "RIM-MailboxAdmins"
| project CmdletResultValue
| extend RoleAssigneeName = tostring(CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName)
| distinct RoleAssigneeName

content.query:
let DefMRA = externaldata (Name:string)[h"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nlepagnez/ESI-PublicContent/main/Operations/Watchlists/standardMRAOnline.csv"]with(format="csv",ignoreFirstRecord=true)| summarize make_list(Name);
let RoleG = ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="MRA",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "Online")
   | project RoleAssigneeName=tostring(CmdletResultValue.Name), LinkedGroup = tostring(CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeType);
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="MRA",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "Online")
| search "*{RoleAssignee}"
| where CmdletResultValue.Name !in (DefMRA) and CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeType == "RoleGroup"  and CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName !contains "RIM-MailboxAdmins" and CmdletResultValue.Name !contains "Deleg"
| project CmdletResultValue
| extend ManagementRoleAssignment = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Name)
| extend Role = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Role)
| extend RoleAssigneeName = tostring(CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName)
|lookup RoleG on RoleAssigneeName 
| extend LinkedGroup = iff(tostring(LinkedGroup)==12, "Yes","No")
| project-away CmdletResultValue
| sort by RoleAssigneeName asc

content.json:
This section displays all the nonstandard delegations done for standard and non standard groups. Indeed, default groups have a list of default delegations but an Exchange administrators can add also new roles to the default groups.

This status is done by comparing current delegation with the default delegation for Exchange 2019 CU11.

Usual results :

  - Delegations done for Organization Management to role like Mailbox Import Export or Mailbox Search

  - Delegation done by mistake

  - Suspicious delegations

Details informations for the user accounts present in the groups will be displayed in below sections

content.title: Information for Role Assignee User account

content.json: Details Information on User account Role Assignee

parameters.name: RoleAssignee
parameters.query:
let DefMRA = externaldata (Name:string)[h"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nlepagnez/ESI-PublicContent/main/Operations/Watchlists/standardMRAOnline.csv"]with(format="csv",ignoreFirstRecord=true)| summarize make_list(Name);
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="MRA",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "Online")
| where CmdletResultValue.Name !in (DefMRA) and CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeType == "0"
| project CmdletResultValue
| extend RoleAssigneeName = tostring(CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName)
| distinct RoleAssigneeName

content.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="DirectRoleAssignments",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "Online")
| where CmdletResultValue.SamAccountName contains "{RoleAssignee}"
| project CmdletResultValue
| extend Account = tostring(CmdletResultValue.SamAccountName)
| extend LastLogon = CmdletResultValue.LastLogonString
| extend LastPwdSet = CmdletResultValue.LastPwdSetString
| extend Enabled = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Enabled)
| extend DN = tostring(CmdletResultValue.DN)
| project-away  CmdletResultValue
| sort by Account asc

items.name: Information for Role Assignee User account

content.json:
This section displays details information for user account found with non standard delegation :
  - Last logon
  - Last Password changed
  - Account enabled

parameters.name: RoleAssignee
parameters.query:
let DefMRA = externaldata (Name:string)[h"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nlepagnez/ESI-PublicContent/main/Operations/Watchlists/standardMRAOnline.csv"]with(format="csv",ignoreFirstRecord=true)| summarize make_list(Name);
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="MRA",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "Online")
| where CmdletResultValue.Name !in (DefMRA) and CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeType == "10"
| project CmdletResultValue
| extend RoleAssigneeName = tostring(CmdletResultValue.RoleAssigneeName)
| distinct RoleAssigneeName

content.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="ExGroup",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "Online")
| where CmdletResultValue.Parentgroup contains "{RoleAssignee}"
| where CmdletResultValue.Level != 0
| project CmdletResultValue
| extend Level_ = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Level)
| extend Parentgroup = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Parentgroup)
| extend MemberPath = tostring(CmdletResultValue.MemberPath)
| extend LastLogon = CmdletResultValue.LastLogonString
| extend LastPwdSet = CmdletResultValue.LastPwdSetString
| extend Enabled = tostring(CmdletResultValue.Enabled)
| extend DN = tostring(CmdletResultValue.DN)
| project-away  CmdletResultValue
| sort by Parentgroup asc

content.json:
This section displays details information for user account present in the found groups with non standard delegation :
  - Last logon
  - Last Password changed
  - Account enabled

content.query:
let StandardGroup = dynamic(["Organization Management","View-Only Organization Management","Help Desk","Records Management","Discovery Management","Hygiene Management","Compliance Management","Security Reader","Security Administrator","Security Operator","TenantAdmins_-xxx","RIM-MailboxAdminsaxxx"]);
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="RoleGroupMember",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "Online")
| where CmdletResultValue.RoleGroup in (StandardGroup)
| project CmdletResultValue
| extend RoleGroup = tostring(CmdletResultValue.RoleGroup)
| summarize Total = count() by RoleGroup
| extend Comment = case (Total>0 and RoleGroup contains "Discovery Management", "❌ This group should be empty Just in time should be used", Total>5 and RoleGroup contains "Organization Management", "❌ The content of this group should limited to only Level 3 Administrators", Total>0 and RoleGroup contains "Hygiene Management", "❌ This group should be empty or only contains Exchange server and/or Exchange antivirus Spam accounts", "Remember to regularly review the content of the group")
| sort by RoleGroup asc
content.title: Numbers of members for high privileges groups

content.json:
All the default Exchange groups located in the default Exchange OU : Microsoft Exchange Security Groups are displayed with their number of members.

It is very important to monitor the content of Exchange groups and raise an alert when a new member is added.

For critical groups, a warning is display if the number exceeded a define thresold :
  - Discovery Management: This group should be empty, so a warning is displayed when the group is not empty

  - Organization Management : This group should only contain only Exchange expert. No service account should be member of this groupe. A warning is display when the total numer of member exceeded 5
  - Hygiene Management : This group can acces and moidify the content of all mailboxes using EWS. A warning is display when the group is not empty. This warning can be ignored if the accounts are the Antispam service account or Exchange servers Computer accounts

items.name: Summarize Number of Member Per Group

content.title: Default Exchange groups content

content.json:
This section the content of the groups with details informations.

It is recommended to check the Last logon and last password change informations.

### How to user this tab
**1 - Select an account** : All the Cmdlet launched by the account during the selected time frame will be displayer.

**2 - Select a cmdlet** : All the roles that contain will be displayed

**3 - Review the list of roles** : This table contains all the roles that contain the selected Cmdlet

### How to undertand the "List of Roles with this CmdLet" table ? 

**WeightRole :** Display the wieight of this role based on its importance in terms of security risk

**SumRole :** Among all the Cmdlet launched by the account during the defined time frame, this role available for x cmdlet. This role include x cmdlet run by the user.

**OrgMgmtRole :** This role is really in the scope of Organization Management group. If the selected Cmdlet is not included is any other role, it make sense that this user is member of the Organization Management group

content.query:
let CounUserCmdlet = (ExchangeAdminAuditLogs
| where Status == "Success"
| extend Caller = tostring(split(Caller,"/")[countof(Caller,"/")])
| summarize Count=count() by Caller);
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="ExGroup",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "Online")
| search CmdletResultValue.Parentgroup == "Organization Management"
| where CmdletResultValue.Level != 0
| where CmdletResultValue.ObjectClass == "user"
//| project CmdletResultValue,Count
| extend Account = tostring(CmdletResultValue.SamAccountName)
| join kind=leftouter (CounUserCmdlet) on $left.Account == $right.Caller
| project Account,Count
//| project-away  CmdletResultValue
| sort by Account asc
content.title: Organization Management Members

content.query:
ExchangeAdminAuditLogs
| where Caller contains "{Account}"
| where Status == "Success"
| distinct CmdletName
| sort by CmdletName asc
content.title: List of CmdLet run by the account

content.query:
let RBACRoleCmdlet = _GetWatchlist('RBACRoleCmdlet');
let UserRoleList = ExchangeAdminAuditLogs | where Caller contains "{Account}" | where Status == "Success" | distinct CmdletName;
let countRole = (RBACRoleCmdlet | where Name has_any (UserRoleList)| summarize SumRole = count()by Role);
let RolevsCmdlet = (RBACRoleCmdlet | where Name has_any (UserRoleList)| summarize make_set(Name) by Role);
RolevsCmdlet
| join kind=leftouter  ( countRole ) on Role
| project Role,CmdletList=set_Name,SumRole
| join kind=leftouter  ( RBACRoleCmdlet ) on Role
| where Name has "{CmdletName}"
| extend PossibleRoles = Role
| extend OrgMgmtRole = OrgM
| extend RoleWeight = Priority
|distinct PossibleRoles,RoleWeight,tostring(SumRole),OrgMgmtRole,tostring(CmdletList)
|sort by SumRole,RoleWeight
content.title: List of Roles with this CmdLet

content.query:
let RBACRoleCmdlet = _GetWatchlist('RBACRoleCmdlet');
let UserRoleList = ExchangeAdminAuditLogs | where TimeGenerated {TimeRange} | where Caller contains "{Account}" | where Status == "Success" | distinct CmdletName;
let countRole = (RBACRoleCmdlet | where Name has_any (UserRoleList)| summarize SumRole = count()by Role);
let RolevsCmdlet = (RBACRoleCmdlet | where Name has_any (UserRoleList)| summarize make_set(Name) by Role);
RolevsCmdlet
| join kind=leftouter  ( countRole ) on Role
| project Role,CmdletList=set_Name,SumRole
| join kind=leftouter  ( RBACRoleCmdlet ) on Role
| extend Roles = Role
| extend OrgMgmtRole = OrgM
| extend RoleWeight = Priority
| extend CmdletList=tostring(CmdletList)
| summarize by Roles,CmdletList,RoleWeight,tostring(SumRole),OrgMgmtRole
| distinct Roles,RoleWeight,tostring(SumRole),OrgMgmtRole,tostring(CmdletList)
|sort by Roles asc
content.title: Recommended Roles for selected users
Let start with Least Privileges with RBAC

content.json:
# Workbook goals
The goals of this workbook is to show you the current RBAC delegation


This workbook will display :

  - NonStandrd RBAC delegation

  - Exchange default group content

  - Analysis of the actions performed by Organization Management members to remove them from the groups

----

## Tabs

### Current RBAC Delegation

This tab will show all the nonstandard RBAC delegation.

**Most of the time RBAC are done and forgotten... This tab will provide a clear statut of the delegation and help with the remediation.**

By nonstandard, it means that the current delegation are compared to the delegation from Exchange 2019 CU11.

Nonstandard delegation for standard groups like Organization Management will also be displayed.

Detail information for  found will be displayed : Last logon, last password changed...

### Default Group content

This tab will show the number of members for default Exchange groups and their content.

Most of the time, the content of common Exchange groups but Exchange is shipped with many groups that have very high privileges and its interesting to see that they are not empty as expected.



### Least privileges analysis

This tab will analysis for each account found in the Organization Management groups :

  - All the Cmdlets launch by an account for the define time frame
  
  - For each cmdlet the list of role where the cmdlet is present
	- Each role will be displayed with a weight depending on the criticity of the role. Low number : critical role
	- Role that are clearly Organization Management role will be displayed with the number : 1

  - Proposition of custom RBAC delegations dependant of the result of the analysis
This section shows the Custom management roles that exist in your environnment and the name of the parent's role

content.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="MRCustom",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "Online")
| extend Identity = CmdletResultValue.Name
| extend ParentRole = CmdletResultValue.Parent.Name
| extend WhenCreated = WhenCreated
| project Identity, ParentRole, WhenCreated, WhenChanged

content.json:
This section displays for the chosen custom management roles all Cmdlets and their parameters associated with this custom role.
Remember that for a cmdlet, some parameters can be removed.

content.query:
ExchangeConfiguration(SpecificSectionList="MRCustomDetails",SpecificConfigurationDate="{DateOfConfiguration:value}",SpecificConfigurationEnv={EnvironmentList},Target = "Online")
| where (replace_string(replace_string(tostring(split(CmdletResultValue.Role.DistinguishedName,",",0)),"[\"CN=",""),"\"]","")) contains "{CustomRole}"
| extend CustomRoleName = replace_string(replace_string(tostring(split(CmdletResultValue.Role.DistinguishedName,",",0)),"[\"CN=",""),"\"]","")
| extend CmdletName = CmdletResultValue.Name
| extend Parameters = CmdletResultValue.Parameters
| project CmdletName,Parameters
